title: What is the significance of the second inner center and how can it be developed through concentration?
first_phrase: This final segment explores refining the inner self through the activation of the second energy center behind the larynx. It is advised to approach the experience of inner sensations with caution, as seeking them out may have negative consequences. An important rule is to only accept an inner experience if it has the same level of immediate evidence as sensory perceptions. The concentration used in the first center can be transferred to the second center, but requires a transformation in the content of concentration. A powerful tool for this transformation is imagination, particularly when in harmony with the concentration formula being used.

last_phrase: In conclusion, in order to activate the second center, it is necessary to transform the content of the concentration to make it capable of changing seats. The transformation of the thought can be achieved by changing the theme of concentration and by coordinating our activities with our aspirations. Remember that the power of imagination is a helpful tool, especially when combined with harmony and concordance. So, let us always strive to be deliberate and motivated in our actions and our words.
